body.name: The Void Beyond: A Science Fiction Horror Novel
body.description: In the vastness of space, something lurks in the darkness.Captain Morgan Starling and her crew travel the stars, shipping cargo from one system to the next. Easy work, until first contact with another race devolved into all-out war.Now, they’re under attack from humanity’s mysterious alien foe, ambushed in the void between systems. When an unknown vessel comes to their aid, events spiral out of control, a twisted secret within its haunted corridors threatening to consume them, body and soul.What they discover within will shatter what they know of life and death. Dragged into a battle with monstrous unfathomable forces, they must escape the nightmarish creatures that lurk out amongst the infinite black of space.Forced into a desperate struggle for life, the crew must survive, if they ever want to get home... Read more

productInformation.value: #157,703 in Audible Books & Originals (See Top 100 in Audible Books & Originals) #2,621 in Space Opera Science Fiction (Audible Books & Originals) #3,336 in Adventure Science Fiction #9,447 in Space Operas

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I have much appreciation for this author for creating this gruesomly awesome story! I absolutely love Sci Fi set in outer space and/or on space ships and this entire novel is in that setting. It starts out fast and the pace continues on in a delightful collage of battles, spacewalks, aliens, ghost ships and a creepy planet. I am onto the next book as soon as i finish this review.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 25, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Got better the more I read
reviews.reviewText: At first this seemed like a basic sci fi story, aliens vs. humans. Then a dead person spoke and things got interesting. And scary. And sad.Good thing I already have the next book.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 18, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars A pretty good story tainted by poor proofreading
reviews.reviewText: I bought this book in search of a good combination of my two favorite genres: sci-fi and horror. There aren’t too many of these books out there. I would say I got what I paid for, easily able to feel immersed in the story I was reading - I finished the book in less than a week. It was an exciting read, full of eerie scenery and action, but I have to knock this 4 star book down to 3 stars because of the proofreading. This book has to have hundreds of spelling errors, grammatical mistakes, and missing punctuation. Character’s names were even misspelled. It became distracting at times, taking away from the excitement of the book. I understand this is an independent publishing, so I’m cutting the author some slack, but it’s as if this book was never proofread at all.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars An Epic Space Horror Adventure
reviews.reviewText: This novel keeps you on the edge of your seat. It’s an action packed, original mystery of a lost crew facing the horrors of the unknown that lurk in the infinite darkness between stars.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars A fun space horror read.
reviews.reviewText: An enjoyable homage to the Dead Space series, with some interesting additions. I enjoyed the mechs and really wanted to see more of them. Needs another pass through to get rid of the small number of errors littered throughout, but an otherwise fun read.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 7, 2021
reviews.reviewText: Loved this story! I have always wondered what we humans would find in the galaxy of space. Other life forms? Good,,,or evil! I loved the main character Morgan and her crew all who have more guts than the average person!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 21, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Not Dead Space in name only
reviews.reviewText: Draws VERY heavily from Dead Space in most areas, but that's not a bad thing. If you thought the undead, mutating flesh monsters, strange alien monoliths and unexplained ghosts from the video game were scary; you'll enjoy this.Setup is just slow enough to build tension and creep factor but the ending feels very rushed in the last stretch as if it was just an outline that didn't get fleshed out.Book is a good prologue to more adventure and body horror in the sequels this book sets up. I'll probably get the next one to see what direction the story goes.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 5, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Thrilling novel like dead space
reviews.reviewText: Exciting story and a very interesting monster, just what I was looking to read. Ends abruptly but I know there are more books in the series which I'm planning to read

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on December 6, 2020
reviews.reviewText: Absolutely gripping and amazing. Couldn't sop reading, a thrill from start to finish. Got the other 2 books to continue

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on April 4, 2020
reviews.reviewText: I ask as clearly English isn't taught anymore.How can someone attend school until 18 now, & have such a poor grasp of punctuation & grammar?I was shocked to see "Could Of" "Would OF" " SHOULD OF" instead of would've, could've , should've actually in print, in a published book! You are abbreviating Would Have, "would of" is utter gibberish, then we have the incorrect use of the basic "To" & "Too", these i keep seeing on Twitter & Reddit, clearly standards are falling, but in a book? Proofreading? Editing? Publishing?PURE ILLITERACY.Then lastly the story, started out interesting, the characters every third word is the F word though, for no apparent reason, they say too much profanity is a sign of a poor vocabulary & poor grasp of English, so maybe this connects to my previous points?Sadly though the interesting concepts of the story are never followed through, answers are never given, & the ending is a rushed cop out where everyone is killed, which makes you wonder who wrote the story?Why should the purchaser of a novel have to not only read it but correct grammar, punctuation & basic junior school level spelling? Without being paid?I dread to think what illiterate twaddle is going to appear over the next few years!
